meanings.definition: To kill with less force or effort than necessary.
meanings.sent1: The hunter tried to underkill the deer by using a small arrow.
meanings.sent2: The assassin decided to underkill the target to avoid drawing attention.
meanings.sent3: The villain's attempt to underkill the hero backfired when the hero easily escaped.
meanings.sent4: The boxer intentionally underkilled his opponent to make the fight more exciting.
meanings.sent5: The chef underkilled the lobster, resulting in it being undercooked and tough.

meanings.definition: A killing that is less than what is needed or expected.
meanings.sent1: The accidental underkill of the mosquito left it buzzing around the room.
meanings.sent2: The underkill of the weeds in the garden led to them growing back quickly.
meanings.sent3: The underkill of the villain in the movie made the audience laugh at the anticlimactic ending.
meanings.sent4: The underkill of the dragon in the legend left the kingdom vulnerable to its return.
meanings.sent5: The underkill of the zombie only made it angrier and more dangerous.
